pattern.name: Zeros
pattern.description:
Returns the count of trailing zeros.
Note: It is implemented only for up to 3 zeros.
pattern.example: Energy consumption in kWh/year entered by the web visitor. If they enter something like 2000, it is most likely just an approximate value and they do not take the problem seriously. If they return 1986, it could be an accurate value.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: SELECT @base , case when 1000*round(@numericalColumn/1000)=@numericalColumn then 3 else (case when 100*round(@numericalColumn/100)=@numericalColumn then 2 else (case when 10*round(@numericalColumn/10)=@numericalColumn then 1 else 0 end) end) end AS @columnName FROM @propagatedTable WHERE @numericalColumn is not null
